messages.message:
btw was this idea discussed further in one of the backend syncs?

for the dependency system proposed by Demetr (scopes + Dijkstra), I think Refiner basically already implements this?
• each line (cleaning prompt / cleaning function) in a field can only refer to previous lines / fields
    ◦ derived fields and custom function fields are represented by cleaning lines in the backend
• maybe @ayesha.ali @pauline.comising could link to the logic in Refiner that figures out the execution order?
Not yet, I will combine it into a document and illustrate the difference.
as a simple example of current limitations - we depend on a field order

Ah ya, refiner just runs fields in order so there's nothing clever that will be able to re-order field execution based on references nor is there any parallelization. iirc there's a comment in our code base about how we don't do any dijkstra-esque traversal for execution, I can look for it after my meeting if that's helpful
